title: Sion ult problem, full control of ult plz fix  [GAMEPLAY]

embed.description: READ DESCRIPTION BEFORE COMMENTING!!! Yes, we hate Teemo. Kay guys you don't have to comment it again. By no means do I main teemo. I'm a support main and jungle main, and I usually play janna, thresh, lulu, maokai, amumu, etc.

body:
So i was playing a casual game and i was laning against Sion. it was pretty even but when Sion reached level 6 he said "hacks activated" and about 2 minutes later he ulted and totally missed it so i thought i was fine but then he did a full 180 degree turn and killed me and throughout the whole game he was trolling with his ult just like the sion in the video . I don't know if this is a bug  but riot plz fix.
p.s. i never noticed anything unusual in his build or anything.

I agree that that is absurd.

On a sidenote, the video was amazing
Oddly enough, this video makes me want to keep it in MORE. That was hilarious.
I know that this is a 'bug' however, this is EXACTLY the way I feel as if his ulti should work!

LOL, thats just 100% hacking flat out, I'd love to see someone try and explain that: "Maybe...... Sion is made of clay in this one game?"
Even though I'd love to personally run around Riven is circles, I would get banned for doing it. That clearly isn't a bug if the Sion would state "Hacks activated."
No it's just Hecarim wearing a Sion costume.
Definitely Not Hecarim when?
http://mcphee.com/creepyhorsemask/images/horselounge.jpg

Yeah, this is a huge problem, the only thing worse than this is how his ult is also bugged when working with player made terrain. If they cast it and you hit it right as it appears, you get deflected completely off of it instead of stunning yourself like normal. I had a Trundle in ARAM put his Pillar under me and turn me literally 180 degrees and run back past two towers right into my nexus.
I played Sion yesterday and did not encounter this. Either this bug is rareish or it was hacking.

If it didn't happen to you, then either you didn't meet the conditions for the bug, or it requires actual file manipulation, which would be against the Terms of Service. Given how the post mentioned that he continued doing it the entire game, he either knew exactly how to exploit the bug, or he was causing it himself.
It's not a bug though. It's a script. Sion's turn speed can be bypassed with packet manipulation.
In which case it's against the Terms of Service, and is a bannable offense.
Does banning people come with a side of E$port$? If not, I can see this lasting a while.

Riot seems to have a fairly hard stance against manipulation of the game from outside sources. This falls into the exact same category as the bug where someone could "1-shot" you with Blade of the Ruined King. What they apparently did was change some game files so it had no cooldown, and spammed it super-fast to kill you.
